elements.name: Authorization Information Qualifier
elements.notes: Code to identify the type of information in the Authorization Information

elements.name: Authorization Information
elements.notes: Information used for additional identification or authorization of the interchange sender or the data in the interchange; the type of information is set by the Authorization Information Qualifier (I01)

elements.name: Security Information Qualifier
elements.notes: Code to identify the type of information in the Security Information

elements.name: Security Information
elements.notes: This is used for identifying the security information about the interchange sender or the data in the interchange; the type of information is set by the Security Information Qualifier (I03)

elements.name: Interchange Sender ID Qualifier
elements.notes: Qualifier to designate the system/method of code structure used to designate the sender or receiver ID element being qualified

elements.name: Interchange Sender ID
elements.notes: Identification code published by the sender for other parties to use as the receiver ID to route data to them; the sender always codes this value in the sender ID element

elements.name: Interchange Receiver ID Qualifier
elements.notes: Qualifier to designate the system/method of code structure used to designate the sender or receiver ID element being qualified

elements.name: Interchange Receiver ID
elements.notes: Identification code published by the receiver of the data; When sending, it is used by the sender as their sending ID, thus other parties sending to them will use this as a receiving ID to route data to them

elements.name: Interchange Date
elements.notes: Date of the interchange

elements.name: Interchange Time
elements.notes: Time of the interchange

elements.name: Interchange Control Standards Identifier
elements.notes: Code to identify the agency responsible for the control standard used by the message that is enclosed by the interchange header and trailer

elements.name: Interchange Control Version Number
elements.notes: This version number covers the interchange control segments

elements.name: Interchange Control Number
elements.notes: A control number assigned by the interchange sender

elements.name: Acknowledgment Requested
elements.notes: Code sent by the sender to request an interchange acknowledgment (TA1)

elements.name: Usage Indicator
elements.notes: Code to indicate whether data enclosed by this interchange envelope is test, production or information

elements.name: Component Element Separator
elements.notes: Type is not applicable; the component element separator is a delimiter and not a data element; this field provides the delimiter used to separate component data elements within a composite data structure; this value must be different than the data element separator and the segment terminator

elements.name: Functional Identifier Code
elements.notes: Code identifying a group of application related transaction sets

elements.name: Application Sender's Code
elements.notes: Code identifying party sending transmission; codes agreed to by trading partners

elements.name: Application Receiver's Code
elements.notes: Code identifying party receiving transmission. Codes agreed to by trading partners

elements.name: Date
elements.notes: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

elements.name: Time
elements.notes: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD

elements.name: Group Control Number
elements.notes: Assigned number originated and maintained by the sender

elements.name: Responsible Agency Code
elements.notes: Code used in conjunction with Data Element 480 to identify the issuer of the standard

elements.name: Version / Release / Industry Identifier Code
elements.notes: Code indicating the version, release, subrelease, and industry identifier of the EDI standard being used, including the GS and GE segments; if code in DE455 in GS segment is X, then in DE 480 positions 1-3 are the version number; positions 4-6 are the release and subrelease, level of the version; and positions 7-12 are the industry or trade association identifiers (optionally assigned by user); if code in DE455 in GS segment is T, then other formats are allowed

elements.name: Transaction Set Control Number
elements.notes: This should be a unique control # for each transaction set functional group

elements.name: Invoice Date
elements.notes: Invoice issue date

elements.name: Invoice Number
elements.notes: Identifying number assigned by supplier

elements.name: Purchase Order Date
elements.notes: Original date (assigned by hospital) of the purchase order

elements.name: Purchase Order Number
elements.notes: Identifying number for purchase order assigned by hospital

elements.name: Release Number
elements.notes: Only used if hospital sent the release # in original PO (element BEG04)

elements.name: Change Order Seq. #
elements.notes: Not used

elements.name: Transaction Type Code
elements.notes: Identifying number for purchase order assigned by hospital

elements.name: Transaction Set Purpose Code
elements.notes: Not used

name: Note/Special Instruction
notes: The NTE segment permits free-form information/data which, under ANSI X12 standard implementations, is not machine processable. The use of the NTE segment should therefore be avoided, if at all possible, in an automated environment.

elements.name: Note Reference Code
elements.notes: Code identifying the functional area or purpose for which the note applies

elements.name: Description
elements.notes: A free-form description to clarify the related data elements and their content

name: Currency
notes: If the CUR segment is not used, monetary values are assumed to be expressed in the currency of the country of the transaction originator.

elements.name: Entity Identifier Code
elements.notes: Code identifying an organizational entity, a physical location, property or an individual

elements.name: Currency Code
elements.notes: Code (Standard ISO) for country in whose currency the charges are specified

elements.name: Exchange Rate
elements.notes: Value to be used as a multiplier conversion factor to convert monetary value from one currency to another

elements.name: Reference Identification Qualifier
elements.notes: Code qualifying the Reference Identification

elements.name: Reference Identification Number
elements.notes: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

elements.name: Description
elements.notes: A free-form description to clarify the related data elements and their content

segments.name: Name
segments.notes: To identify a party by type of organization, name, and code

elements.name: Entity Identifier Code

data_type_ids.SO: Sold To If Different From Bill To

elements.notes: Code identifying an organizational entity, a physical location, property or an individual

elements.name: Name
elements.notes: Free-form name

elements.name: Identification Code Qualifier
elements.notes: Code designating the system/method of code structure used for Identification Code (N104)

elements.name: Identification Code
elements.notes: Receiver ID Number

segments.name: Additional Name Information
segments.notes: To specify additional names or those longer than 35 characters in length

elements.name: Name
elements.notes: Free-form name

elements.name: Name
elements.notes: Free-form name

segments.name: Address Information
segments.notes: To specify the location of the named party

elements.name: Address Information
elements.notes: Address Information

elements.name: Address Information
elements.notes: Address Information

segments.name: Geographic Location
segments.notes: To specify the geographic place of the named party

elements.name: City Name
elements.notes: Address Information

elements.name: State or Province Code
elements.notes: Code (Standard State/Province) as defined by appropriate government agency

elements.name: Postal Code
elements.notes: Code defining international postal zone code excluding punctuation and blanks (zip code for United States)

elements.name: Country Code
elements.notes: Code identifying the country

segments.name: Administrative Communications Contact
segments.notes: To identify a person or office to whom administrative communications should be directed

elements.name: Contact Function Code
elements.notes: Code identifying the major duty or responsibility of the person or group named

elements.name: Name
elements.notes: Free-form name

name: Terms of Sale/Deferred Terms of Sale
notes: To specify terms of sale. In the Header position of the Invoice X12 EDI document, this segment is used to specify terms of the invoice. In the transitional period for the microcomputer industry, from paper to full automated EDI transactions, there may be a perceived need to send text data with the terms. Clearly the goal is to have the entire microcomputer industry participating in EDI. Therefore, if text data is needed to be sent for terms, ITD 12 will contain the free form text. If additional text is needed, additional ITD segments should be used.

elements.name: Terms Type Code
elements.notes: Code identifying type of payment terms

elements.name: Terms Basis Date Code
elements.notes: Code identifying the beginning of the terms period

elements.name: Terms Discount %
elements.notes: Available to hospital if invoice is paid on or before Terms Discount Due Date

elements.name: Terms Discount Due Date
elements.notes: Date payment is due if discount is to be earned (CCYYMMDD)

elements.name: Terms Discount Days Due
elements.notes: Maximum number of days to pass before payment is due

elements.name: Terms Net Due Date
elements.notes: Date when total invoice amount is due

elements.name: Terms Net Days
elements.notes: Payment terms in net days

elements.name: Terms Discount Amount
elements.notes: Total amount of terms discount

elements.name: Terms Deferred Due Date
elements.notes: Date deferred payment or percent of invoice payable is due

elements.name: Deferred Amount Due
elements.notes: Deferred amount due for payment

elements.name: % Invoice Payable
elements.notes: Amount of invoice payable expressed in percent

elements.name: Description
elements.notes: Description of terms

name: Date/Time Reference
notes: To identify a person or office to whom administrative communications should be directed

elements.name: Date/Time Qualifier
elements.notes: Code specifying type of date or time, or both date and time

elements.name: Date
elements.notes: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

segments.name: Baseline Item Data (Invoice)
segments.notes: To specify the basic and most frequently used line item data for the invoice and related transactions

elements.name: Assigned Identification
elements.notes: Alphanumeric characters assigned for differentiation within a transaction set. May be original line number from PO

elements.name: Quantity Invoiced
elements.notes: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD
